alert.note: Alert for Coffee; Geneva (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 5:23PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN COFFEE AND WESTERN GENEVA COUNTIES THROUGH 600 PM CDT... At 521 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Opp, moving southeast at 20 mph. At 410 PM CDT, the Andalusia-Opp Municipal Airport gusted to 41 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Samson, Kinston, Earlytown, Hacoda, Pera, Spears, Alberton, Perry Store, Weeks, Sellersville, Lytle, Rhoades, Marl, Ino, Logan Field Municipal A/P, Ganer, Holley Store, and Lowery. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
